page.title: 02GARFORTH POLICE STATION
page.content: Garforth has one{police station.} There are two{cells,}one for men and one for women. Each cell contains a toilet, wash basin, wooden bench to sleep on and a few blankets. In the door is a food hatch. Before the {prisoners}go in, items of clothing such as belts, shoes, watches and chains are removed so the window can not be smashed. The prisoners are only kept there temporarily. After that they go to a proper prison. For the police there is a relaxing room with a television and a kitchen. There is a special yard where all the Police {transport}is kept. Approximately 6O officers work at Garforth Police Station. The {shifts}are 8 hours long. They get 35-4O calls a day. The main cause of the calls is trouble with neighbours and accidents. The beats are balanced between cars and foot.
